item.title: Joe add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Impartiality is a pompous name for indifference which is an elegant name for ignorance." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Joe add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "I regard golf as an expensive way of playing marbles." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Joe add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Journalism largely consists in saying "Lord Jones is dead" to people who never knew Lord Jones was alive." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Joe add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "The object of opening the mind, as of opening the mouth, is to shut it again on something solid." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Joe add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Love means to love that which is unlovable; or it is no virtue at all." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Joe add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Without education, we are in a horrible and deadly danger of taking educated people seriously." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Joe add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "It has been often said, very truly, that religion is the thing that makes the ordinary man feel extraordinary; it is an equally important truth that religion is the thing that makes the extraordinary man feel ordinary." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Joe add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "No man who worships education has got the best out of education... Without a gentle contempt for education no man's education is complete." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Joe add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Psychoanalysis is confession without absolution." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Joe add a quote by Wolfram Von Eschenbach
item.description: "Fear not those who argue, but those who dodge." -- Wolfram Von Eschenbach

item.title: Joe add a quote by Christopher Morley
item.description: "I went to the theatre with the author of a successful play. He insisted on explaining everything. He told me what to watch, the details of the direction, the errors of the property man, the foibles of the star. He anticipated all of my surprises and ruined the evening. Never again! And mark you, the greatest author of all made no such mistake." -- Christopher Morley

item.title: Joe add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "A good novel tells us the truth about its hero; but a bad novel tells us the truth about its author." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Joe add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "There are those who hate Christianity and call their hatred an all-embracing love for all religions." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Joe add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "These are the days when the Christian is expected to praise every creed except his own." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Joe add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Psychoanalysis is a science conducted by lunatics for lunatics. They are generally concerned with proving that people are irresponsible; and they certainly succeed in proving that some people are" -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Joe add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Religious liberty might be supposed to mean that everybody is free to discuss religion. In practice it means that hardly anybody is allowed to mention it." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Joe add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A great many of those who 'debunk' traditional...values have in the background values of their own which they believe to be immune from the debunking process" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Joe add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "We regard God as an airman regards his parachute; it's there for emergencies but he hopes he'll never have to use it." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Joe add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Try to exclude the possibility of suffering which the order of nature and the existence of free-wills involve, and you find that you have excluded life itself" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Joe add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "If naturalism were true then all thoughts whatever would be wholly the result of irrational causes...it cuts its own throat." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Joe add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "[Consciousness] is either inexplicable illusion, or else revelation." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Joe add a quote by C. S. Lewis
item.description: "Odd, the way the less the Bible is read the more it is translated" -- C. S. Lewis

item.title: Joe add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Solitude is painful when one is young, but delightful when one is more mature. " -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Joe add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "You’ll consider what you did wrong & bookend your reflections with hunger – no supper, no breakfast." -- Stephen King

item.title: Joe add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I must learn to be content with being happier than I deserve." -- Jane Austen
